definition.featurexml: <xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><block type="feature_container" deletable="false" x="40" y="40"><value name="feature"><block type="feature_tree_spruce"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="0"></mutation><field name="base_height">8</field><field name="height_variation_a">3</field><field name="height_variation_b">2</field><field name="force_dirt">FALSE</field><field name="ignore_vines">TRUE</field><comment pinned="false" h="104" w="218">This block represents a spruce tree, and should generate during the VEGETAL_DECORATION stage.</comment><value name="dirt"><block type="blockstate_selector"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="0"></mutation><field name="block">Blocks.DIRT#0</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the block that will be placed under the trunk</comment></block></value><value name="trunk"><block type="blockstate_selector"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="0"></mutation><field name="block">CUSTOM:FirLog</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the block used for the trunk</comment></block></value><value name="foliage"><block type="blockstate_selector"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="0"></mutation><field name="block">CUSTOM:FirLeaves</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the block used for the leaves</comment></block></value><value name="radius"><block type="int_provider_uniform"><field name="min">2</field><field name="max">3</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This represents the maximum radius of the foliage. Note that high values might cause leaves to decay</comment></block></value><value name="trunk_height"><block type="int_provider_uniform"><field name="min">1</field><field name="max">2</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This determines how many blocks of the trunk will remain exposed, starting from the bottom of the tree</comment></block></value><value name="root_placer"><block type="root_placer_none"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">Spruce trees don't have roots</comment></block></value></block></value><next><block type="placement_count"><comment pinned="false" h="105" w="222">Placement modifiers are processed from top to bottom. We try to place 4 trees in each chunk</comment><value name="count"><block type="int_provider_constant"><field name="value">4</field></block></value><next><block type="placement_in_square"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="189">We then move each tree horizontally, so that they don't generate in the corner of the chunk</comment><next><block type="placement_surface_water_depth"><field name="depth">0</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is how deep the water can be for the tree to generate. If the value is 0, the tree will never be submerged</comment><next><block type="placement_heightmap"><field name="heightmap">OCEAN_FLOOR</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">We then move each feature to the highest solid block (which might be underwater)</comment><next><block type="placement_biome_filter"><comment pinned="false" h="85" w="210">We check that the tree doesn't generate in the wrong biome</comment></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></xml>
